message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.CY, cs.MM

This paper deals with the task of detecting memes in social media, which involves analyzing large streams of social data and clustering messages based on their similarity. This task falls under the broad category of social media analysis, which is covered by several sub-categories in arXiv CS. 

The most likely sub-category is cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), which deals with the analysis of social networks and their properties. This paper specifically focuses on detecting memes through social networks, making cs.SI the most relevant sub-category.

The second likely sub-category is cs.SD (Software Engineering), which deals with the development and evaluation of software systems. This paper presents a framework for detecting memes through clustering, which involves developing and evaluating a software system.

The third likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and text analysis. This paper involves analyzing text messages in social media to detect memes, making cs.CL relevant.

The fourth likely sub-category is cs.CY (Computers and Society), which deals with the social and ethical implications of computing. This paper involves analyzing social media data, which has significant social implications, making cs.CY relevant.

The fifth likely sub-category is cs.MM (Multimedia), which deals with the analysis and processing of multimedia data. This paper involves analyzing messages in social media, which can include multimedia content, making cs.MM relevant.
